articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Post publishes last Khashoggi op-ed before disappearance
articles.description: The Washington Post on Thursday published the final op-ed from Jamal Khashoggi's before his disappearance. The paper's global opinions editor Karen Attiah joins Morning Joe to discuss Khashoggi and his column.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Two Americans wounded in Kandahar, Afghanistan attack
articles.description: NBC’s Hans Nichols reports on a Taliban attack in southern Afghanistan that wounded two Americans. The new U.S. commanding general in Kandahar was present, but initial reports suggest he was not injured.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Rod Rosenstein defends Mueller probe in interview
articles.description: In a rare interview, Deputy AG Rod Rosenstein defends the Mueller investigation, calling it appropriate and independent.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Trump on midterms: A vote for is a vote for me
articles.description: Trump is making the midterm elections about him, even though he's not on the ballot. At rally after rally, he says a vote for the candidate he's stumping for is really a vote for him. Steve Kornacki looks at the numbers.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Trump: China's election meddling is a bigger problem than Russia
articles.description: In a new wide-ranging interview with CBS, Trump was pressed on his comments around Russia and election meddling and again stated he believes China's election hacking is a big problem. Jeremy Bash joins to discuss.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Rep. Schiff on Trump’s new comments about Mueller
articles.description: With 22 days left until the midterm elections, Trump refuses to pledge to let the Mueller probe continue.  House Intel Ranking Member Rep. Adam Schiff reacts to that and says Congress has become complicit and failed to assert itself in this presidency.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: GOP aims to suppress ND Native American vote to hinder Heitkamp
articles.description: Rachel Maddow looks at new rules Republicans in North Dakota have imposed that make it harder for Native Americans to vote, undercutting a key part of Heidi Heitkamp's constituency.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Native Americans rallying to overcome GOP obstacles to voting
articles.description: O.J. Semans, executive director of Four Directions, a Native American voting rights group, talks with Rachel Maddow about the effort to overcome new obstacles North Dakota Republicans have put in place to make it harder for Native Americans to vote.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Trump got personally involved in Stormy Daniels pushback strategy
articles.description: Emily Jane Fox, senior reporter for Vanity Fair, talks with Rachel Maddow about Donald Trump violating his promise not to get involved in his company's business, and personally directing employees, including his son, Eric, on pushing back against Stormy Danie…

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Last Word 10/15/18
articles.description: Watch the full episode of Monday night's The Last Word with Lawrence O'Donnell.
articles.content: Up next in: The Last Word full episodes

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Panel: Will Arizona become a swing state?
articles.description: Brahm Resnik & Maria Polletta discuss how Arizona could become a swing state by 2024.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: From ‘fixer’ to ‘PR person’; Trump’s latest claim about Michael Cohen
articles.description: AP’s Jonathan Lemire, MSNBC contributor Eddie Glaude, Weekly Standard’s Charlie Sykes, and NYT’s Mark Leibovich on Trump’s claim that Cohen was lying when he testified that the president directed him to break the law

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Despite lag in polls, a key group of Texans could help Beto pull off an upset
articles.description: WaPo’s Robert Costa, AP’s Jonathan Lemire, MSNBC contributor Eddie Glaude, Weekly Standard’s Charlie Sykes, and NYT’s Mark Leibovich on the Texas senate race and key factors of  Beto O’Rourke’s strategy to beat Ted Cruz

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: GOP candidates resort to scare tactics to turn out voters
articles.description: With their majority in the US House at risk, Republicans have waged a fear mongering campaign to scare voters away from their Democratic rivals instead of campaigning on the tax cuts.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Hardball 10/17/18
articles.description: Chris Matthews and a panel of guests discuss the political news of the day.
articles.content: Hardball with Chris Matthews 10/17/18 Chris Matthews and a panel of guests discuss the political news of the day. descriptionLimit">... more Duration: {{video.duration.momentjs}} Up next in: Hardball full episodes

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Trump, Pompeo continue to defend Saudi Arabia
articles.description: President Trump and Secretary of State Mike Pompeo continue to defend the Saudi regime in the wake of more details behind the disappearance of Jamal Khashoggi.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: GOP steps up vote suppression as Democrats grow in determination
articles.description: Rachel Maddow looks at Republican vote suppression tactics around the United States as congressional elections draw near and early voter turnout suggests soaring public interest.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Kareem Abdul-Jabbar: Kaepernick continuing civil rights movement
articles.description: Legendary NBA player and activist Kareem Abdul-Jabbar tells Ari Melber that “we will get past” the Trump era, by focusing on issues that Americans “hold common”. Abdul-Jabbar also comments on Colin Kaepernick, saying the issues he is calling attention to are …

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: How the Trump administration is demolishing the federal government
articles.description: Author Michael Lewis  on how the Trump administration has hobbled vital functions if the U.S. government through understaffing, incompetence, indifference and compromised motives.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Burleigh: Trump 'learned that he really liked the pliant' woman who could be molded into his 'archaic ideal of what a perfect woman is'
articles.description: Nina Burleigh,  Newsweek’s national politics correspondent & author of the new book “Golden Handcuffs: The Secret History of Trump’s Women,”  tells Alex Witt about the six most influential women in President Trump’s life.
